Articles.Content:
I suggest a large mount R&D facility that would be about the same size as the hitch-hiker pod. It would maybe be called the "Science Sr." or something along that line. the piece would basically be a larger data gathering system that would require an electric charge and possibly give out timed reports like every 10 Kerbal days(maybe just the standard report). Also suggested is a minimum crew to run.

I think a large mount science piece is a needed.

Edited October 23, 2013 by Avera9eJoe
added suggestions given

Hi,

+1 - I like the idea of automated reports. Is there scope for a future camera module, which combined with the automated reports feature gradually builds up a map of the planet your probe is orbiting?

I agree with having a large science part, the size of a Hitchhiker.

I also think that a apart from a huge load of electricity that it should require a minimum crew, say two, in order to operate. It should also be much heavier than a Hitchhiker, in the 10-18 ton range, for the sake of gameplay balance.

I disagree with the timed reports thing though

I also think that a apart from a huge load of electricity that it should require a minimum crew, say two, in order to operate

Great Idea. Love it. Also there should be a mapping piece added to the game. AND Coordinates should be visible when hovering over a planet. not after you land.

Timed reports would be pretty cool but I'd go both ways depending on the balance.

Should I start a pole?

I could also create a modded piece probably to do that
